greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of positive integers k such that n - L(k) is a positive squarefree number, where L(k) denotes the k-th Lucas number A000204(k).
comment: This has been verified for n up to 5*10^9.
See also A304331 for a similar conjecture involving Fibonacci numbers.
For all n, a(n) <= A130241(n). - _Antti Karttunen_, May 13 2018
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
Zhi-Wei Sun, Mixed sums of primes and other terms, in: Additive Number Theory (edited by D. Chudnovsky and G. Chudnovsky), pp. 341-353, Springer, New York, 2010.

Zhi-Wei Sun, Conjectures on representations involving primes, in: M. Nathanson (ed.), Combinatorial and Additive Number Theory II, Springer Proc. in Math. & Stat., Vol. 220, Springer, Cham, 2017, pp. 279-310. (See also arXiv:1211.1588 [math.NT], 2012-2017.)
example: a(67) = 2 with 67 - L(1) = 2*3*11 and 67 - L(7) = 2*19 both squarefree.
maple: a := proc(n) local count, lucas, newcas;
if numtheory:-issqrfree(n - lucas) then count := count + 1 fi;
results.author: _Zhi-Wei Sun_, May 11 2018
